text: Young Workers' International (in German: Arbeiter-Jugend-Internationale, in French: L'Internationale des Jeunesses Ouvrières) was an international union of socialist youth organizations. It was founded in at a conference in Amsterdam May 12-May 13, 1921. It functioned as the youth wing of the remnants of the Second International. Its secretary was Erich Ollenhauer. It published Die Arbeiter-Jugend-Internationale. In 1923, it merged into the Socialist Youth International. Category:Youth wings of political parties Category:Youth organizations established in 1921 Category:Socialism in the Netherlands
title: Young Workers' International
